summary: This bill, the 'Supporting Made in America Energy Act,' mandates increased oil and natural gas leasing on federal lands and waters. It requires the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a minimum number of annual lease sales in specific states and in the Gulf of Mexico and Alaska regions. The bill also modifies the timeline of the oil and gas leasing program, prevents the President from impeding energy mineral leasing, thereby impacting environmental regulations and promoting domestic energy production by increasing the availability and frequency of lease sales.
